medium: ink and light color on silk
title: Monkey Hanging from a Branch
marks:
Signature and Inscription

LE: [Meiwa(?) 7th yea LE
text: Ōkyo founded the Maruyama school and based his works on direct observation of nature, giving them a distinct realism. Ōkyo’s keen eye is obvious in the firm grip of the monkey’s paws and the wrinkles around the monkey’s eyes, which gives its gaze such intensity.
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
